intro: Antisola racemosa, commonly known as the clustered antirrhinum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of showy, tubular flowers. The flowers are typically pink to purple in color and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
